title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 § 490.1 - Payments to persons in military services
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 § 490.1 - Payments to persons in military services

State Regulations
(Unemployment Insurance Law, §§517, 518). Any
payments made by an employer voluntarily and without contractual obligation, to
or in behalf of a person for periods during which such person performs military
services in the armed forces of the United States or any State, do not
constitute wages on which contributions are payable under the New York State

Unemployment Insurance Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§
490.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
